subject: Climate & Environment
title: Fog Catchers and Dew Harvesters
description: A 60-second lesson on Fog Catchers and Dew Harvesters.

hook.text: In the Atacama Desert â€” the driest place on Earth â€” villages harvest water from fog.

buildup.text: Large mesh nets catch tiny fog droplets, which drip into collection tanks below.

discovery.text: A single fog catcher can collect 200 to 1,000 liters per day depending on conditions.

twist.text: Dew harvesters use radiative cooling to condense moisture from clear night air.

climax.text: These low-tech solutions cost almost nothing to maintain and need no energy at all.

punchline.text: Where there's fog, there's water. You just need a net to catch it.
